intro: Hydrolea spinosa f. glabrispina, commonly known as the smooth-spined hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
